September 1986 No 18

The Kathleen Lonsdale Lectures

At the last Council meeting it was resolved that the BCA should inaugurate a series of annual lectures to commemmorate the work of the late Dame Kathleen Lonsdale. The British Association for the Advancement of Science has agreed that the lectures should be given during the BA Annual meeting. They will be public lectures and BCA members will be free to attend. The first Kathleen Lonsdale Lecture will be in Belfast in August 1987. Council has invited its President Professor D.M.Blow F.R.S., to be the lecturer. Further details will be given later.

December 1987 No 23
From the BCA Secretary
The Annual Meetng of the British Association was held this year in Belfast. The first Londsdale Lecture was given by our President Professor David Blow on Augsut 27. His lecture on 'Enzyme Engineering' was extremely well received and we extend our congratulations to him as the opening Lonsdale lecturer and for raising the enthusiasm of the public for our subject.

The Lonsdale lecturer next year will be Professor Michael Hart who will present his lecture at the British Association meeting in Oxford. Further details will be announced in subsequent newsletter.

Intensive Course in X-Ray Structural Analysis
The second school in in the planning stages and is expected to take place at Aston University immediately following the BCA meeting in Oxford, April 1989. Further details will be given in the next newsletter. Any Commercial readers willing to sponsor a part of this vital teaching course should contact:
the Organiser, Dr. David Watkin, Chemical Crystallography, Oxford University or
the Course Treasurer, Dr. Judith Howard, Bristol University.
